gurmukhi: swgVdI swNg sMgHY qwgVdI rx qurI ncwvih ] JwgVdI JUm igr BUim swgVdI surpurih isDwvih ]
transliteration: Saagaddisaan Sanrahai Taagaddiran Turinachaavah(i)|| Jhaagaddijhnm Gir Bhoom(i) Saagaddisurpurah(i) Sidhaavah(i)||
translation: Holding the lances the warriors are causing them to dance in the war and after swinging and falling on the earth, they are leaving for the abode of gods;

gurmukhi: AwgVdI AMg huAY BMg AwgVdI Awhv mih ifghI ] ho bwgVdI vIr ibkRwr swgVdI sRoxq qn iBghI ]561]
transliteration: Aagaddian Huai Bhan Aagaddiaahav Maih Dig-hee|| Ho Baagaddiveer Bikraar Saagaddisronat Tan Bhig-hee||561||
translation: The brave fighters are falling with chopped limbs in the battlefield and their dreadful bodies are saturated with blood.561.

gurmukhi: rwgVdI ros irp rwj lwgVdI lCmx pY DwXo ] kwgVdI kRoD qn kuVXo pwgVdI huAY pvn isDwXo ]
transliteration: Raagaddiros Rip Raaj Laagaddilachhman Pai Dhaayo|| Kaagaddikrodh Tan Kudyo Paagaddihuai Pavan Sidhaayo||
translation: The enemy-king Ravana fell in great fury on lakshman and went towards him with wind speed and great ire;

gurmukhi: AwgVdI Anuj aur qwq GwgVdI gih Gwie pHwrXo ] JwgVdI JUim BUA igrXo swgVdI suq bYr auqwrXo ]562]
transliteration: Aagaddianuj Ur Taat Ghaagaddi Gad(i) Ghaae Prahdaryo|| Jhaagaddijhoom(i) Bhooa Giryo Saagaddisout Hair Outdaryo||562||
translation: He inflicted a wound on the heart of Lakshman and in this way wreaking vengeance on him for the killing of his son, he cused the fall of Lakshman.562.

gurmukhi: cwgVdI icMk cwNvfI fwgVdI fwkx f`kwrI ] BwgVdI BUq Br hry rwgVdI rx ros pRjwrI ]
transliteration: Chaagaddichink Chaanvadidaagaddidaakan Dakkdaree|| Bhaagaddibhoot Bhar Dare Raagaddiran Ros Prajdaree||
translation: The vultures shriked and the vampires belched; burning in this fire of fury in the battlefield the ghosts and others were filled with joy;

gurmukhi: mwgVdI mUrCw BXo lwgVdI lCmx rx juJXo ] jwgVdI jwx juiJ gXo rwgVdI rGupq iem buJXo ]563]
transliteration: Maagaddimoondchhaadbhayo Laagaddilachhman Ran Jujhyo|| Jaagaddijaan Jujh(i) Gado Raagaddiraghoupat Im Bujhyo||563||
translation: Lakshman while fighting in the field became unconscious and Ram, the king of Raghava clan, considering him dead, became pale.563.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky rwmvqwr lCmn mUrCnw Bvyq iDAwie smwpqm squ ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Raamavtaar Lachhman Moondchhanaa Bhavet Khiaae Samaaptam Sat(u)||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled ‘Lakshman becoming Unconscious’ in Ramvtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.

gurmukhi: kwgVdI ktk kip BjXo lwgVdI lCmx ju`JXo jb ] rwgVdI rwm irs BrXo swgVdI gih AsqR ssqR sB ]
transliteration: Kaagaddikatak Kap(i) Bhajyo Laagaddilachhman Jujjhyo Jab|| Raagaddiraam Ris Bdaryo Saagaddigad(i) Astra Sastra Sabh||
translation: The force of monkeys ran helter-skelter when Lakshman fell down and catching hold of his weapons and arms in his hand Ram was highly infuriated;

gurmukhi: DwgVdI Daul DV hVXo kwgVdI koVMB kV`kXo ] BwgVdI BUMim BVhVI pwgVdI jn plY pl`tXo ]564]
transliteration: Dhaagaddidhaul Dhad Hadyo Kaagaddikodanbh Kadakhyo|| Bhaagaddibhoonm(i) Bhad-harijam Padai Palattyo||564||
translation: With the clattering sound of the weapons of Ram, the Bull, the support of the earth trembled and the earth shook as if the doomsday had arrived.564.

gurmukhi: kFI su qyg du`DrM ] AnUp rUp su`BrM ] Bkwr Byr BY krM ] bkwr bMdxo brM ]565]
transliteration: Kadhisu Teg Duddharan|| Anoop Roop Soubbharan|| Bhakaar Bher Bhai Karan|| Bakaar Bandano Baran||565||
translation: The double-edged swords came out and Ram seemed greatly impressive; the sound of the kettle-drums was heard and the imprisoned people began to cry.565.

gurmukhi: bicqR icqRqM srM ] qjMq qIKxo nrM ] prMq jUJqM BtM ] jxMik swvxM GtM ]566]
transliteration: Bachitra Chitratan Saran|| Tajant Teekhanndnaran|| Parant Joojhatan|| Janank(i) Saavanan Ghatan||566||
translation: A queer scene was created and the forces of men and monkey fell on the demon forces with sharp nails like the rising clouds of the month of Sawan.566.
